website_summaries.verdict: Two pieces that parlay into a variety of fits depending on your needs.
pros: Pants have a classic straight-leg design with adjustable leg opening
Full-length jacket provides ease of movement
Lightweight but highly effective in protecting from light rain
This suit breathes, allowing for intense performance in a variety of conditions

customer_reviews.title: It does not keep you dry on a motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: After reading several good reviews of the Frogg Toggs suit, I was excited to purchase it and give it a try. Unfortunately it basically failed completely at what it was supposed to do. I drove 20 minutes on my motorbike to work in a light rain and had a fairly wet shirt as a result all the way down the front. On the way home from work that day I drove another 20 minutes in a fairly heavy rain and ended up with my front fully soaked from shirt to pants. The suit leaked horribly and did not keep me dry in the least. I cannot recommend this product and I plan on returning mine as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: DRS83

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: This is not waterproof! I've worn this rain suit twice in a light rain and the sleeves and shoulders soak through in a few minutes. The fabric stays wet for days. I don't mind the paper-like fabric. I just wish this product was waterproof as advertised. Unfortunately for me, I ordered these in June but just started wearing them now that the summer heat is subsiding, Amazon says it's too late for a return.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Not very water resistant, soaked after working 12 hour day in and out of the rain and the suit.
customer_reviews.text: A rain suit is supposed to protect you from the rain, this frogg Toggs, all sports suit does not do it. I was looking for a decently made rain resistant suit that was also breathable and not going to leave you soaking wet from sweat because it was not breathable at all, this suit is breathable, but not waterproof at all. I work as an Amazon delivery driver working 12 hour days in and out of the rain, my arms were soaked within minutes, my upperbody stayed somewhat dry but my midsection from stomach down to my feet (Jeans soaked) was pretty much soaked after 12 a hour day.
customer_reviews.author: Rottie fan 77

customer_reviews.title: Review about fit
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the suit in the rain. However, here are my thoughts on the fit. First, some information: I bought medium. I’m 5’8”. I weigh 195 lbs. I’m proportionally built. I wear 16.5”x33” shirts. I wear 34”x32” pants. The jacket was loose fitting in the sleeves, chest and waist. The sleeve length was just right. The pants aren’t snug, but they are just barely big enough to fit over another pair of pants and still have a little room. The length fit just right. I would prefer slightly roomier pants.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Small is quite large
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried it in the rain yet but they’re definitely not designed to fit a woman’s body. I’m 5’4” and ordered a small. They’re huge! The waitband of the pants sit right under my breasts. But I bought this set to store on my boat if we get caught in the rain, so how they look on me isn’t too important.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Dominis

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on first use
customer_reviews.text: These look amazing, feel great. But my first time wearing them the pants ripped down the seam in front. Super bummed out because they seem good but must have had a defect. : (
customer_reviews.author: papajamie8

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the feel of them fool you.
customer_reviews.text: Though these feel like a paper hospital gown, they are awesome! I have gone through so many different types of rain gear, I have lost count. These are the most waterproof and breathable. The only thing I would change is there aren't any pockets on the jacket or pants. I have worn these through several storms and they have been great. No leaks and they don't make me sweaty. I just bought 2 more pair.
customer_reviews.author: Denise T

customer_reviews.title: Runs large/long
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my son to take to Philmont Scout Ranch. He is 18 years old, 6 feet 225 lbs. and usually wears large and xl sizes. The XL size was way too long in the sleeves and pant legs. We returned them. Quality was heavier than his older cheaper Frogg Toggs from about 8 years ago which work great and are still in decent shape. I would recommend these but order a little on the smaller side and measure your arms and legs before ordering to compare the sleeve and pant leg lengths.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Great For Extreme Hot Weather Rain Storms- Great Keep w/ Fishing Gear Etc... For Sudden Downpours
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal product. It keeps one dry in the heaviest southern downpours and does not cause one to sweat or overheat in the extreme heat. Like gortex, it is breathable and about a fraction of the weight. Unlike heavy gortex though, will not cause one to overheat in extremely hot temperatures. Packs up nicely into a small package. Great product to keep with one's fishing gear for sudden downpours, or emergency situations, etc....
customer_reviews.author: Beat a ’Bhèist

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Rode over 100 miles in the rain, often through torrential downpours and this suit was a real champ! I was bone dry everywhere except the front collar of my shirt. That's my fault though...i didn't close the neck properly just because I hate high collars. It would have worked marvelously with a long face mask. I am 5'10 210 lbs and got the extra large. I had plenty of room while wearing jeans and sweatshirt underneath. I could easily have worn a coat underneath for added warmth if needed. I wish it came with its own storage bag, but I ordered one for right around $5 and I'm okay with that. Terrific product. I would definitely recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Sfittro

customer_reviews.title: Extra Large IS extra large
customer_reviews.text: I bought an XL in order to have the suit fit over my clothes. That probably wasn't necessary. It is slightly too big -- even when I wear bulky clothes under it. It seems to be of reasonably sturdy material. It is weatherproof for normal rain. (No, I didn't stand in the shower like one reviewer. I realize that the suit is not designed for that.) A baseball cap would be a good accessory to wear under the hood -- the hood closes down over your face otherwise. My one complaint is that the cord for the hood is too short. it is difficult to tie.
customer_reviews.author: Corbett B. Coburn III

customer_reviews.title: Disposable and Useless
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed Frog Toggs. I wore them hiking for a single day, and a patch of the water-repellant layer was worn through on the pants. They have no durability. Furthermore, they didn't protect me from a light downpour and I was soaked at the end of the day. They work well when the rain falls directly downwards, but if there is a slight breeze you're getting soaked. Unfortunately the return window closed and I am stuck with these. Hopefully this review keeps you from making the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisey and More
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rain suit for hunting. When I tried it on, I was surprised at just how much noise it made any time I moved. Thinking it might improve with breaking in, I put it in the dryer on a delicate system to warm the plastic and hopefully break it in. 30 minutes later the jacket and trousers and shrunk in height to 25% of what they were but maintained the width - a troll suit in other words. More the fool I. I gave it two stars as a hunting garment. For the dryer experiment I gave myself a 5 star idiot rating.
customer_reviews.author: Leitz

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: maybe I was expecting too much - I ordered the wrong size, which was my fault, but before I returned them they just felt cheap so I didn't replace with the correct size. they felt like they were too thin and almost made of paper - I am sure that they are 100% better than those cheap generic PVC ones that do not breath at all but do not look like they will last. I ended up returning it & ordering another Carhartt shoreline jacket to go with the one that I have been using for over 10 year
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: You'll stay dry and have room to wear warm cloths.
customer_reviews.text: okay - just finished a four-hour Penn State game in continuous moderate to heavy rain on 11/18/2019. We Are! Anyway - this was the best purchase of the season and the first time I was able to use the product. It was well worth the money as I didn't have a damp spot on me. Many people commented that the are very large, they are supposed to be cut large so you can fit your cold-weather gear under neither if you wish. I was perfectly warm AND dry for the game. Thanks, I will be purchasing these for my kids when they are a bit older..
customer_reviews.author: M. Flinn

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: It served me well for a wet day of hiking in the brush in the mountains of Colorado. Went about 5 miles and they were alright. However when I sat down for the evening, I noticed the crotch area was pretty worn where my legs may have rubbed. No holes yet, but already pretty worn after one use. Just keep in mind that these things are invincible. I'm about 5'9, wear 34x30 pants and a large t-shirt size, and the size Small of these fit me well. They make them pretty big.
customer_reviews.author: Cecily & Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting at all... and not in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this suit, I saw it said Polyester and expected some type of coated fabric. Not a color version of a paper suit I can buy at home depot in the paint aisle. I am totally disappointed with this suit and astonished that it cost me $61. This thing will rip the first time it gets caught on anything. It's definitely going back.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Genzlinger Jr

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: I wear 2xl shirts and they run a little loose, usually. I saw reviews noting this runs large so I went with the xl. It's still larger than expected. As a 6' 230 lbs fat guy, a large would likely be all right. Such is the risk of ordering online! It'll work for now. I was not intending to wear it over my motorcycle gear but it fits over it anyway so if I need it for some reason on the bike, I'm covered.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Steward

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP MATERIAL!  Beware.
customer_reviews.text: The lining is shredded. Opened the package and the jacket looks like it has been attacked by a rodent or just rotted. The lining is in shreds! Extremely disappointed as it is needed tomorrow for a 2 week hunt. No time to return. Guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Makadamia

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used for white water rafting in Grand Canyon. We purchased 2 suits - some product and same size. My suit held up well but my husbands did not (he was soaking wet while I had some water seepage). The black pants are hot on your knees in the blazing sun - I placed a wet sarong on my knees to cool them off (without getting my skin wet). The material was not slippery (which is a good thing when the rapids are whipping the raft about). I would purchase again but my husband would not (although his jacket was better then the pants).
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: There were a couple of things that I had to learn about the rain suit. # 1 is that you have to snap the cover over the zipper in any significant rain and # 2 the elastic in the cuffs is not very strong so if you have your arms raised in any significant rain it runs inside. I carry som Velcro straps to tighten the cuffs. I like the light weight and breathability.
customer_reviews.author: Fred S. Judkins II

customer_reviews.title: Sorting The Confusion
customer_reviews.text: My parents bought my husband Frog Toggs for his birthday and so did I. The set my parents bought ripped the first time my husband wore them because they were cheaper and of much lesser quality. The set I bought are 5 star, the sizing is accurate and the material is much much more durable. Still no pockets though. So if you buy a pair don't get the cheaper travel version. I paid $42 for the really nice set and they are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Mcelrath

customer_reviews.title: I will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wet weather bicycle rides to work. I have an electric assist bike and ride about 3 to 5 miles a day. They work perfectly for my needs and the price is excellent. A lighter and breathable fabric would be better but would then be loads more expensive. If your commute is longer or physically demanding, these would likely feel too heavy and hot. The fabric feels and weighs like a cloth version of rain coat material.
customer_reviews.author: professor

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a Reason
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a Large and was way too big. I wear a 34 waist and the pants would not stay up. Exchanged for a medium and they fit great. Until I took my tarp down in a downpour. First time I knelt down the crotch seam split. I got the spend the next 5 hours in a cold rain in a canoe with a wet crotch. Not fun. Save yourself the hassle and invest in better rain pants.
customer_reviews.author: Gru

customer_reviews.title: Not Good at All
customer_reviews.text: I returned these after receiving them. They were HUGE. I usually wear a large jacket. I read the reviews and ordered a medium. Still way way to big. Plus the material feels very bizarre and is not something that would be comfortable wearing all day in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: McA

customer_reviews.title: Order Direct from Frogg Toggs if you are considering this Rain Suit.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Amazon seller JH Direct. Material started to shred after just a few times wearing it. It’s a rain suit so not something you wear everyday and it was over 90 days so JH Direct would not help. I contacted Frogg Toggs and received an RMA due to a year warranty. Would have been easier if ordered direct from Frogg Toggs. Did not receive replacement yet so time will tell if it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: No pockets!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the rain set 2 month ago. Finally I got a chance to wear it yesterday and found out no where to put my wallet and cell phone. I live in Texas. It's hot even in rainy days, no way for me to wear another coat under this one to hold the cell phone and wallet. Or, do I have to take a waterproof case hanging on my neck for storage every time wearing this? This doesn't sell as a rain poncho, right? Where is my pocket?!!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rain Gear
customer_reviews.text: Frogg Toggs are light weight, breathable and practical. I took this on our trip to Ireland in February where it rains everyday and sometimes the winds, depending on the locale, can be up to or over 40 MPH. You can tighten the hood down and add the water proof FT hat. Wearing the entire ensemble, you are completely covered and good to go. A great purchase. I will also use this for fishing trips!
customer_reviews.author: nerak1051

customer_reviews.title: rain suit great but pants too short
customer_reviews.text: i bought this Small rain suit and it works as advertised. I have traveled on my motorcycle under heavy rains in Florida for 1 hour or more and when i got home I was completely dried inside. The only thing was the pants length is too short so my pants got wet. I did not order Medium because jacket is too big and even small size is bulky. I contacted seller but no response. To cover pants I ended up getting shoe rain covers that go up some length and that worked.
customer_reviews.author: wa254

customer_reviews.title: Better than that rubber gear.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible stuff, the fit is excellent snug closers on wrist and ankles. Draw strings to pull in tighter. I didn't think much of it taking it out of the bag but after being out in a solid rain moving at 30mph didn't get wet at all. Definitely will recommend and buy again. Includes 2 hangers for easy drying when done.
customer_reviews.author: Solo flyer

customer_reviews.title: Jacket buttons will not stay snapped in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: They definitely fit baggy. I'm 5' 7" 185lbs and I ordered a medium and it's still fairly baggy on me. Now I know these dont say motorcycle rated but I used them for riding. The pants worked as advertised, and the velcro at the bottom held at 75mph in the rain. However the buttons on the jacket dont snap tight and will not hold against the wind so I had a line of water on my shirt from the rain getting through the zipper. I was im impressed that the stretchy material on the cuffs worked very well and held a good seal on my gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Size does matter!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Frogg Toggs rain suit today.. I purchased as motorcycle rain gear.. I'm 6'1, 245 lbs, fairly broad in the shoulders.. I ordered the XXL due to other comments.. However, even with my motorcycle jacket and jeans on this XXL is way too large.. I think wearing this on a bike would make me a kite.. I'm returning it and will order the XL. The Jacket and Pants material seem fine from what I can tell. The XXL pants were probably 2-3" too long and the jacket was probably 3" too big all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Great buy for the bucks
customer_reviews.text: Not bad went through some real bad rain and for the most part I didn't get to wet...was a little wet in the front in the bend in front of stomach. Very happy with product.. also seem to be around proof which was very nice.. had only a t-shirt on and its was a chilly bit I was good.. didn't get hot! Also I am 6feet 199lbs i ordered a Med and perfect fit.. was a little shorter than I would like but that was ok because I bought the rain boot protector so they came up over the pants to cover that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Your size is soooo important.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these before a big ride and there was supposed to be bad weather, well I never got to use them, I did try them on though. I ordered the wrong size. Although I can put them on over all my clothes without any problem. The issue was my fault but I can make them work. pretty neat how they keep you dry. very light weight and if you get the right size, I'm sure you will love them. keep them away from hot engine and pipes though. No issues so far. check the sizing chart carefully. I believe it is accurate,
customer_reviews.author: Ironlou

customer_reviews.title: NO POCKETS - ANYWHERE!!
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived and THERE ARE NO POCKETS! Not in the jacket, not in the pants. It never occurred to me to check for something so basic before purchasing. I'm going to do further research on other products and will probably be returning these. Really, why would you make a jacket without pockets to stick your hands in when it is raining???
customer_reviews.author: Chris Irwin

customer_reviews.title: I love Frogg Toggs
customer_reviews.text: These are great for keeping dry in wet weather and they provide some warmth too. Easy to slip then on and off as the day warms up. Breathable so that you don't get sweaty while wearing them. Also a cheap way to get come camo clothing for hunters. They are not heavy duty clothes so they will tear or rub through with heavy wear.
customer_reviews.author: R. Price

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for riding my motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Does what they say they do, keeps you absolutely dry. Not much breathability, I swear quite a bit if hot outside, but that’s expected since they keep the rain out. I ride my motorcycle daily, rain or shine, and I’ve rode to work several times in a downpour and these keep me bone dry. They aren’t exactly compact when folded up, but they fit under my seat with plenty of room for my other crap. Overall, this rain suit is superior to any suit that is supposedly designed for motorcycle riding, and about half the price. If this suit ever wears out, I’m definitely buying another one
customer_reviews.author: Adam I.

customer_reviews.title: Glorified garbage bags
customer_reviews.text: The crotch ripped out of the pants the first time I crouched down in them. The set is comically oversized. They get really stinky if you wear them for a few days. They are pretty loud for hunting. But they will keep you dry if you somehow keep them in one piece. These would be fine as an emergency rain set in your truck or boat or something, but they are way too flimsy for regular or even occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Valerian

customer_reviews.title: Runs much larger than expected. Otherwise, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Put this on when I saw I’d be riding through a storm on my motorcycle. Kept me dry, but my pants burned on the pipes (not their fault, these weren’t made to withstand that kind of heat). Anyway, the reason for 1 less star is that I ordered a Large which is what I always wear, but it was extremely big. I had a thick leather coat on underneath this jacket and it was still big and baggy. May want to order a size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good Rain Suit.
customer_reviews.text: I have friends that love these suits. It just seems like a heavy tyvex painters suit to my. But it works.... Aside from the feel, I use it as a windbreaker and rain coat and it works well. I bought a 2x and should have gotten an XL. Size is true or a touch bigger than you expect. I wanted extra room since I'm in law enforcement and needed to cover extra gear. I would recommend this rain suit. It is very light as well and I have been using it several weeks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for motorcycle trip in Patagonia
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to wear the rain-gear for several days on a recent motorcycle trip down South America. The jacket and pants were perfect; not a drop of rain got through. I am not sure if they were designed for the open road, but they worked great. They fit a little big and I wished there was one or two pockets on the outside, or easier access inside to clothes pockets. But they still get a 5/5 rating and would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: Me and the wife switched over to these for our summer ride and left the leathers at home to save space in the bike. Got rained on sideways for 6 days straight through Florida, Alabama, and Georgia this year and stayed dry the entire time. Highly recommend if you do summer rides in the rain. Won’t keep you super warm it the winter though I imagine, have yet to try. Removed the hood and had to roll down collar a bit to keep from running my chin is the only “complaint” I have.
customer_reviews.author: Hossie

customer_reviews.title: Good so far.
customer_reviews.text: Only wore once, but they kept me dry and warm. It was a chilly morning, and they cut the wind pretty good, which makes me think they'll be hot on warmer days. For the price though, I would recommend. I ordered same size as I would for pants and jacket and they fit over clothes fine.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great rain suits
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both have a pair of these rain suits and they are wonderful. Hood is big enough to fit over a bike helmet. The pants close at the ankle to water doesn’t go up your legs. Rolls up great to store in a bookbag or large purse. We always keep these in our trunk. Easier than an umbrella once it’s on, keeps you drier. Dries faster than an umbrella too.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Feels like paper. No pockets. Trash!
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage. Delivered with a big hole. Feels like I’m wearing a paper bag. No pockets. Nothing like pictures. The hospital of doesn’t even fit over a person’s head. Not good for hunting at all! Please take this back. I’d like a refund. Fit good. Just not deal for hunting. Made cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia0000

customer_reviews.title: Works great, keeps me dry!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light weight, breathable, rain suit and this does the job well. I've heard a lot of good things about Frogg Toggs but never owned one for myself. I use this while working in the garden during rain pours, keeps me dry and not as hot as other rain suits. It's on the bigger size, I usually wear and medium/large and the medium is quite big.
customer_reviews.author: Takeo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value and light weight protection from the weather.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value and light weight protection from the weather. I heard about these from a very experienced hiker, so I gave them a shot. I immediately got to try them out on a backpacking trip that had more than its share of torrential rain, and they performed perfectly. I have since purchased both the UL rain suit and the poncho as well, so I have Frogg Toggs for all types of trips. Highly recommended. While the weight is very good, it would be helpful if they could compress down any smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: these are great! i got a pair for me and my ...
customer_reviews.text: if you are trying to decide what size to buy, just go ahead and get the size you normally wear. you dont have to buy larger to wear over your clothes, they have already adjusted the size considering you will be wearing clothes under them. these are great! i got a pair for me and my husband to keep in the trunk of our bike in case rain breaks out while we are riding. the small mens size works great for a medium size woman.
customer_reviews.author: mama e

customer_reviews.title: Pants melt on Motorcycle exhaust
customer_reviews.text: They work to keep me dry, but (maybe I read wrong somewhere) they are not really appropriate for motorcycle riding, if you have exposed exhaust. Wore them for about 30 mins today, and have a nice 3 inch hole in the right leg where they melted on the exhaust. Looking around for nomex or some other type of pants now.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted a pair of these by a relative. After trying them, I sent these to my brother for his birthday. He doesn’t own a car, and rides a motorcycle every day. These are fantastic for rainy days on the bike. While they look funny on a motorcycle, they keep you dry. Even at 50 Mph in a full rain, the areas covered stay dry. Ankles? Hands? Neck? Soaked. What can you do though right?
customer_reviews.author: Anonymousreviewer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a FROGG TOGG BELIEVER!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! My husband and I use these when we trail ride on 4wheelers. Not only does it keep you dry as a bone in pouring down rain, it holds in heat too! Plus you can toss them in the washer and hang them up to dry, no problem. I am a huge fan of frogg togg rain gear now! Nothing works near as good! You'll probably think what I did when you open it for the first time, its thin and flimsy like its made of paper! TRUST ME, It will pay for itself the first time you use it. You'll be a believer too!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: bulky and no ventilation
customer_reviews.text: it works, and actually i can wear the jacket on top of my backpack. but it takes up too much space and hard to pack. a bit unwieldy to wear, the hood can block your vision and does not allow much adjustment. no ventilation, so expect to get wet in your own sweat when wearing this for long. good enough for the price, but better to spend more on a higher quality rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: subhacom

customer_reviews.title: Not waterprood AT AL, also tears/shreds on the tiniest sticks and such
customer_reviews.text: This material does not stop water AT ALL. Rain will soak all of your under layers when wearing this, and the material is like a "nonwoven" that shreds whenever it touches any surface that isn't perfectly smooth. Easily the most delicate "sport" equipment there is, and the least weatherproof rain material there has ever been. I have not used this much since it is more or less useless. If you wanted camo covering for whatever else you may want to wear then this may be ok for you, but it is NOT a rainsuit by any means, nor is it ready for any sort of "sport".
customer_reviews.author: D. Betournay

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Did not keep me dry in a fair amount of rain. After about 10 minutes I could feel my shirt getting wet and see very little water shedding off the jacket but rather soaking into the fabric. Might be good for a slight drizzle but it for very much more.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory Disappointing in practice.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to sit in the rain during the Army-Navy game. It was brand new out of the package when I put it on in the parking lot. By the time the game was over and I walked back to the car, the knees, seat, and back of the legs were all pilled and worn. All this from sitting in a stadium seat and, on occasion, standing and cheering at a Navy touchdown. I'll give you that Navy scored a lot but a walk back and forth from the parking lot, sitting for 3 hours, and standing up for 5 touchdowns and the National Anthem shouldn't wear out a pair of rain pants. Not Good.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Blok

customer_reviews.title: Great material and quality but large.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I am usually smaller in everything, I’m a 0-2 in size so I expected these to be a little large, however the pants I have to pull up to my chest to fit! Now for anyone riding a bike or motorcycle the length is probably perfect but for me to work on a boat way too big. Hopefully they will come up with petite sizes. However the jacket is awesome super comfortable and for me that alone is worth the cost. I’ll save the pants for Hurricane emergencies .
customer_reviews.author: Grace Miller

customer_reviews.title: So I love the product
customer_reviews.text: So I love the product, to be honest I feel it is a 5 star rating however, I used this for the first time this weekend and not even 50 miles into my ride I noticed a gaping hole on the inside of my right knee. Now, there could be a few explanations.... 1. The rip/tare was already there and I failed to see it before putting the pants on. 2. The rip/tare occurred during riding. Either way I have yet to reach out to the company, but I feel that it just could be happenstance and I received a bad pair of pants. All in all the product is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Cant beat the price and it kept me dry in pouring rain, numerous times. It’s held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mea

customer_reviews.title: Stay dry all day
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because of a long weekend fishing trip where it rained all day. There were six of us that fished in the rain pretty much non stop. Five of the six peoples rain suites eventually became soaked. But my father-in-laws Frog Togs held up the whole time. I usually where a large shirt size and medium pants. Since this is not a choice when ordering I ordered large size. It was huge on me, I had to send back and get the medium. Medium fits fine. I am size 42 chest and 34-30 pants.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a hole
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a sizeable hole in the jacket by the logo. Very disappointed. The fabric seems like it would tear easily anyway even with light use.
customer_reviews.author: beezy

customer_reviews.title: Work well, but bulky/large
customer_reviews.text: I wish I hadn't kept these. They do as they say, but they are uncomfortable, bulky and huge. We bought smaller based on other reviews and they are still too large. I wish I had sent them back. They just stay in a cabinet because they are too large to put in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dillingham

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material. No pockets on the outside (I knew this before purchasing, no big deal). Material is not lightweight and does not pack well (it is bulky when folded). Not really for ultralight backpacking or hiking. It is bigger than expected. I normally use medium (ordered medium) and could very well fit in a small.
customer_reviews.author: Roy-E

customer_reviews.title: Outside Worker's Review
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight, has no restriction and even during a downpour you don't get wet. The only wetness that you may get is just from your own sweat while wearing it. My job requires me to be flexible and this allows me to move freely and it does not catch on anything around me. It's warm and you sweat in it but the breathable material is way more comfortable than I would be in a regualr raincoat and hat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Tomt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are very water and windproof. When combined with a suitable undergarment, they are very warm in windy, wet conditions. The only drawback is that the texture of the material is like paper, rather than cloth. But, for the price and performance, I am willing to ignore this. Definitely get the models that have pockets for your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Steve SB

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rain suit for the price! Keeps me dry in all types of rain, folds reasonably small for carrying. Light weight, so great for use in warm weather. Fits rather loosely, which allows you to use it over a jacket and street clothing without feeling too confined. An excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: K9 Rick

customer_reviews.title: doesn't breath, makes sounds
customer_reviews.text: Mine were camo, so I figured they were intended for hunting. No. They are very loud when you move, alerting deer of your location. They do not breath if you move too much. You will be exhausted and very sweaty if you walk far in these things. They cost me a nice buck this year.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pigwillow

customer_reviews.title: KEEPS YOU DRY IN ANY WEATHER.
customer_reviews.text: These were a Christmas Gift for my grown son. He's a carpenter and mentioned recently how much he hated getting soaked when working outside in bad weather. I have a set of these for myself and really like them; they work great are lightweight and seemingly breathable. My only criticism is that it would be nice if these had pockets or at least cut-outs to access pockets in whatever clothing is being worn beneath them. Otherwise perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a backpack hunting trip and didn’t need it until this last week when I was getting rained on 5 miles back in the mountains. I was very disappointed when I found that the zipper was broken on my first use. Terrible quality and much larger then I expected. I would never buy anything from this brand again. Can’t return it because it’s too late. I hate throwing money away.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for playing disc golf in the rain. They worked perfectly - I was completely dry after playing in a tournament with steady rain all day long. My only suggestion would be to create a way to reach my pockets with them on. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Pants are HUGE
customer_reviews.text: jacket fits great over my standard hooded sweatshirt, pants fit well over my jeans and boots BUT they are absurdly long. Granted I ordered an XL because I'm a little bit heavier but the length.. I normally wear a 30 or 32 length jeans and these are easily 6 inches too long. I guess I'll tuck them in my boots when I'm riding
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: easily goes on over all kinds of clothing
customer_reviews.text: My old poncho was not getting the job done on some of our rainier camp outs. I needed something with more coverage. This entire rainsuit packs into the same space as my poncho and with boots on keeps me 100% dry. Pros: Light weight, water proof, easily goes on over all kinds of clothing, folds nicely into a small area that you can easily stuff in a compression sack or a backpack compartment. Cons: Even after use and trying other methods to soften, the suit is still pretty stiff and makes noise when I move, so I would not recommend for hunting where you need to move quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gohlke

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting at all. If you want a rain suite that works. Bottom line is it has to be plastic. I understand you sweat more in complete plastic. But it is what it is. If your bucking in the rain you will either sweat or get rain wet. I have learned that I prefer vented plastic overcoats. Hope that helps
customer_reviews.author: Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Ruined after First day of use
customer_reviews.text: This product is made of very cheap fabric. The inseam tore the first time our caretaker squatted to pick up some leaves. It appears to be a waste of money. The fabric does no slip or slide when you move.
customer_reviews.author: rlou

customer_reviews.title: It looks much better than it actually works
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product about a month ago and today during Florida's first tropical storm, Tropical Storm Colin, I was working outside. I felt water on my back,,, my pants and boots also got wet. I won't be ordering another set. It looks much better than it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Kem

customer_reviews.title: Works good just be gentle on seams and watch for snags.
customer_reviews.text: It works just be gentle with it. Im 5'9 194lbs and ordered xl jacket and 2x pants for the ease of slipping on and off over work jeans and boots. They work good just be gentle on seams and watch what you brush up against it will snag amd tare easy... as far as breathable it blocks the wind and i get pretty warm in mine
customer_reviews.author: Bryce S

customer_reviews.title: Pants way too big in comparison to jacket
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used yet for our Colorado trip but the pants are HUGE. Inseam comes to middle of my chest and legs are six inches too long and overly full through the legs. But Velcro at the bottom make hemming impossible. Jacket has features I like so I’ll probably keep the set but not use the pants.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Phares

customer_reviews.title: They leaked at the worst possible time
customer_reviews.text: Took a work trip south 1100 miles to Charleston SC. Ended up in a severe thunderstorm for 10 hours riding in the soaking rain. After the first hour of use, I felt water leaking in the seat of the pants and got completely drenched. It was a cold soaking wet ride for the rest of the trip that day...I wasn't a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: No pockets, and jacket is olive green.
customer_reviews.text: Jacket is an olive green, not stone/gray Looks like sturdy, quality material, with lined seams to prevent leaks at seams. Has a stiff, almost paper-like texture. I was surprised there are no pockets in the pants nor in the jacket. Bought these for golf, so need at least one pocket for tees, ball markers, etc. Will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Sunseeker

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, great price
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, great price. This is a back-up pair I keep in my truck at all times in the winter months here in Wisconsin. The material is very thin yet no matter how cold it is outside, I stay one temp which is a tad on the cool side. Because it is so thin, I can roll it up, and it fits in my average size purse. This is a ton more convenient than my down-filled, calf length winter coat which I wear only when I want to be stylish like going to church.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly effective for budget motorcycle rain gear
customer_reviews.text: Went on a motorcycle camping trip, couldn't afford waterproof gear so I grabbed this, sized down based on other reviews and the fit was great, I am normally a 3xl but got 2xl and the fit was perfect over my riding pants and my riding jacket. Kept these packed in my tail bag and as soon as we hit rain I hopped off and put these on and they kept me perfectly dry. They were comfortable and easy to pack away when not in use, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Vonjentzen

customer_reviews.title: It was cold, wet, snowy, sleety and frigging dark
customer_reviews.text: Only thing these need are pock slats to access your pockets and wider cuff adjusters on the arms and legs. for that only 4 stars. these kept me dry and warm in 20 degree weather that seen the gambit of rain, sleet, and snow while hauling azz on my atv.
customer_reviews.author: idaho dave

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for your money
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's the best you can buy. I use mine for calving at night, in snow and rain, and the jacket and pants have performed well. The fabric breathes fairly well, so there isn't a sweat problem inside the suit. It sheds water and you can close the suit up tight so nothing comes in. It has held up well this calving season, I have handled over 400 calves wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Wind Set

customer_reviews.title: looks good and packs small
customer_reviews.text: I got the set pants and jacket the pants fit over a pair of jeans nice but the jacket is BIG would be ok over a winter coat but a we bit large for just a tee shirt so if you want it for warmer weather get a size down .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is terrific waterproof gear. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is because of the sizing. I thought the medium would be a good choice to wear over mountain bike clothes and arm/knee pads, especially for someone my size with "biker legs." However, both the jacket and pants were quite large. The medium would likely fit someone who is at least 5' 8" and over 160 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Size runs large.
customer_reviews.text: Finally wore the old frog togs out (over 5 years old and primarily used for motorcycle riding). Size here runs on the larger size. Husband usually wears 2XL/3XL Harley Shirts and this XL raingear fit him perfectly over jeans/tshirt/leather jacket. Good quality, breathable material, easy to ride with gear on, light weight. Only dislike is that there are no pockets.
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: Feels like tarp material
customer_reviews.text: Just received order today. Feels like tarp material if it protects against rain I will be fine. Rains alot here in el salvador. I will update when I wear item.
customer_reviews.author: jerry patton

customer_reviews.title: Poor fabric material
customer_reviews.text: I wore these on an elk hunting trip as my outer waterproof layer. I am 5' 9" and got a medium. They fit perfectly over 4-5 layers of clothing underneath. However when I squatted down the crotch ripped open. Yes the material is waterproof but I wouldn't wear them over a lot of layers or they will rip. They also don't have any pockets so that was a hassle for me trying to quietly lift up my jacket to get to my radio underneath. They were good for a one use trip, but the fabric is thin and easily rips. When I gutted the elk these got all bloody so I just threw them away after the hunt.
customer_reviews.author: Gramotron

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: These actually performed a lot better than expected. I wore them for a straight week fishing in hard rain in Canada and they held up. I did get a little damp but considering the conditions that's pretty great! Other people were wearing $300 guide gear rain suits and I wore these. They made fun of me quite a bit but once they saw that this stuff was actually working they were as impressed as me.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: Great gear for outdoor wear
customer_reviews.text: We ride motorcycles and this specific product was recommended by a close friend. We haven't had that unpleasant opportunity to use them but feel confident everything will be perfect should we need rain gear. I was told it would help tremendously in cold weather as well.
customer_reviews.author: RMH

customer_reviews.title: Rain suit  not meant for heavy duty use  it will keep you warm and dry in the rain
customer_reviews.text: Really nice rain suit. Remember you didn’t pay a lot for it because it is very light weight! I had to use it today because It was raining cats and dogs. And I had to digging a ditch. Very muddy it did keep me dry but the crotch ripped out about a 3 inch rip right where you would put a zipper. Not disappointed because it kept me warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 14 year old son to wear on an ATV trip in case it rained. It rained. He work it day 1 of the rain for about 4 hrs. Water got in the pants. Jacket held up good. He work it day 2 of the rain for about 4 hrs. The pants nearly disintegrated. He was soaked from the waist down. Jacket held up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Size runs very large.
customer_reviews.text: Returning this item. Ordered size medium as a gift for someone who loves to fish, rain or shine and it is way too big! I’m sure it is waterproof which is what he needs but it is made with material that reminds me of a tarp. There is limited range of motion for the type of fishing he does.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a light weight, inexpensive suit but didn’t expect the pants to tear from crotch and knee the first time hiking. Extremely flimsy. They are great in the rain, and I suppose if you’re not moving they would work as expected. Will not waste my hard-earned money on these again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Has a slimmer sportier fit than other frogg toggs. I am 6’ 175lb and the medium fits great. For the price you can’t beat it. But I will say that after 50 miles riding the butt was showing wear. But again great product for the price, wear them out, replace them and you still will not have paid as much as you would for a pair from Black diamond, Patigonia or North face.
customer_reviews.author: MagLion

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the warmth in!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! My husband ran the 24 hour Spartan Ultra World Championship in Iceland and bought these as his outer wear. He wore them for 20 hours of straight running through the snow/wind in the mountains and they kept him warm and protected. He was actually getting pretty sweaty because they kept the warmth in so well! His only suggestion was sinch ankles like the wrists because the leg opening was so wide and the Velcro wouldn't close them up tight enough. It wasn't a big enough inconvenience to not give 5/5 stars though! We will be purchasing more, as he put his through hell and we had to pitch them. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price! They do run large, normally need size large but ordered medium and they still have plenty of room for layers. Totally waterproof even on a motorcycle at freeway speeds for extended time periods. Light, pack-able and breathable. Highly recommended for motorcyclists rain gear.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Kaloczi

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My husband attempted to lift his leg a few inches while wearing the suit, on the day directly after we got them and the entire leg split at the seam from knee to hip. Poorly made. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Maxine

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Not flame retardant!
customer_reviews.text: One thing I would like to add. Work needs to be done in this fabric. Bought theses as a gift I have bought several sets. My brother in-law is superintendent or grounds for our town. He was using a chain saw and a spark coughs the pants on fire. It happened very fast burnt through to his jeans. NOT GOOD. We were going to order for the whole crew but can’t have this happing. Feel so bad big whole in paints. I may file a complaint with the company. Just for safety reasons. Other then that. We love these Toggs. I have bought many differnt toggs. The hats too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was a bit skeptical when I bought these frogg toggs for him in case of bad weather when he was on the Harley. He had to use them a week or so ago when he got stuck in a rain storm and has nothing but positive things to say about them. They kept his clothes dry and he has told everyone he knows about them. I’m so glad I took a shot and got them for him.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good entry-level rain suit.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are a great rain suit. I wore them off and on for a week while on a fishing trip and it kept me dry. I also wore it during an outdoors event that I was working at and I stayed dry despite incredible downpours. My only disappointment is that some of the seams do not appear to be sealed very well. I could see light around the threads. Time will tell if it holds together. That said, at this price point I'm satisfied with the performance and like how windproof they are, while not being hot like typical plastic or rubber rainsuits are.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinlow

product_meta.title: FROGG TOGGS Men's Classic All-Sport Waterproof Breathable Rain Suit
product_meta.description: That’s a lot of different fabrics for a product that is, at the end of the day, designed to keep you dry. We are often asked — why so many choices? Basically, because you, our customer and reason for being, requires it
feature_bullets: All-Sport Rain Suit includes a jacket and pant
Made with Frogg Toggs breathable, non-woven fabric that is waterproof, wind-resistant, and lightweight
Jacket features an adjustable, removable hood and a full-length parka-cut, open-waist design
Jacket zipper is covered by a snap-down storm flap and elastic cuffs are provided to keep you dry
Pant features an adjustable, elastic waist and adjustable leg openings

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
